critique: The document is a formal executive order. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and security in the government's ability to respond to the national emergency. There is no explicit mention of emotions, so I will have to infer them from the context and tone. The invocation of emergency powers suggests a need for decisive action, which could evoke fear in some, but the overall tone is one of resolve and control. The limitation on judicial review aims to prevent obstruction and maintain efficiency. The act of publishing the order aims to inform the public and demonstrate transparency. I will start with initial scores and then critique them.
